structure.unit: ESCAPE AND OTHER OFFENSES RELATING TO CUSTODY

law.catch_line: Hindering prosecution or apprehension in the second degree.

text.section: A person is guilty of hindering prosecution or apprehension in the second degree when, with the intent to hinder the apprehension, prosecution, conviction or punishment of another who is being sought in connection with the commission of a criminal offense, he renders assistance to such person.
Hindering prosecution or apprehension in the second degree is a Class A misdemeanor.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 181, effective January 1, 1975.
